official-title.#text:
To establish a grant program in the Department of Education to promote the involvement of female
			 students in science, technology, engineering, and mathematics and for
			 other purposes.

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on
committee-name.#text: Committee on Education and the Workforce

committee-name.#tail:
, for a period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for consideration of such
			 provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the committee concerned

cosponsor.#text: Mrs. Carolyn B. Maloney of New York

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Advancing Girls in STEM Act of 2014
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Advancing Girls in STEM Act of 2014

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, only 26 percent of
			 employees in STEM fields were women, while 74 percent were men.

text.#text: According to a September 2013 report by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
report states that employees in STEM fields earn 26 percent more than
			 their non-STEM counterparts.

text.#text: A
Women in STEM jobs earn 33 percent more than comparable women in non-STEM jobs.
The United States ranks 25th in mathematics and 17th in science among industrialized nations.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, only 15 percent of the world’s scientists reside in the
			 United States and only 5 percent of United States workers are employed in
			 fields related to science and engineering.

For purposes of this Act, the following definitions shall apply:

term.#tail: means each State of the United States and the District of Columbia.

text.#text: The term

term.#tail: means science, technology, engineering, and mathematics.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: Secretary of the United States Department of Education

text.#text: The term

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall award grants to States to carry out the programs described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Advancing Girls in STEM Act of 2014/s:4/ss:b

text.#text: The

A State that receives a grant under this section shall use the grant to carry out programs that
			 promote the involvement of female students at the elementary school and
			 secondary school levels in STEM fields.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall award grants to States, on a competitive basis, in accordance with the
			 following criteria:

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall award 1 grant to each of 2 States in each of the following geographic regions:

text.#text: The

Alabama, Florida, Georgia, Kentucky, Louisiana, Mississippi, North Carolina, South Carolina,
			 Tennessee, Texas, and Virginia.

Arkansas, Illinois, Indiana, Iowa, Kansas, Michigan, Minnesota, Missouri, Nebraska, Ohio, Oklahoma,
			 South Dakota, and Wisconsin.

Connecticut, Delaware, the District of Columbia, Maine, Maryland, Massachusetts, New Hampshire, New
			 Jersey, New York, Pennsylvania, Rhode Island, Vermont, and West Virginia.

Alaska, Arizona, California, Colorado, Hawaii, Idaho, Montana, Nevada, New Mexico, North Dakota,
			 Oregon, Utah, Washington, and Wyoming.
The amount of each grant shall be $2,500,000.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall distribute grant funds in accordance with this section not later than the date
			 that is 1 year after the date of enactment of this Act.

text.#text: The

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
at
			 such time, in such manner, and containing such information as the

text.#text: To be eligible for a grant under this Act, a State shall submit an application to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, on an annual basis, identifying how the grant funds were used
			 and the number of students who participated in the programs carried out
			 with the grant funds.

text.#text: As a condition of receiving a grant under this Act, a State shall agree to submit a report to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall, on an annual basis, and using the reports received under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Advancing Girls in STEM Act of 2014/s:4/ss:e/p:1

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
on the overall impact and effectiveness of the grant program
			 under this Act.
